instruction: Apply his theory to the following scenario.
input: John Locke argued for the existence of natural rights, such as the right to life and liberty.
output: John Locke's theory of natural rights can be applied to the scenario by understanding that everyone has the right to life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness. This implies that every individual has the right to live as they choose and enjoy the freedoms and autonomy that come along with it, so long as they do not infringe on the rights of others.
